body.p: The PDU has a Main Input Circuit Breaker to the transformer and an optional Main Output Circuit Breaker from the transformer to the Distribution Subfeeds ( and ).
The main input bus is also compatible with a main lug only (MLO) power feedâ€”that is, without a main breaker.
The following illustration () shows the locations of power distribution components. Typical one-line electrical diagrams using different input and output voltages are shown in and .

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22039 0000012247_P-164001123 PowerHub 2 Power Distribution Unit 400-1125 kVA Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\12.pdf

body.p: An optional secondary output circuit breaker can also be installed in the main cabinet as well as SPDs (). For PDUs over 750 kVA input and optional secondary output circuit breakers must be installed in a sidecar. (See .).

With the Manual Dual PDU Option, dual input circuit breakers are also placed in the main cabinet. (See and ). A secondary output circuit breaker cannot be installed in the main cabinet when dual input circuit breakers are installed.

fig.title: Secondary Output Circuit Breaker in Main Cabinet
